caption: Home to the city's China town and skyscrapers, renewed as "street art capital of the world", 13th arrondissement is quickly loosing "not so funky" label while mixing with success old and new architecture, exotic food and traditional pastry shops, industrial spaces dedicated to the culture and hubs, large boulevards with narrow streets with hidden history. Town Hall has reception area where you can find out every information you might need around. Caf√® machine with italian coffee.
It's Chinese New year ü•≥üéà party ‚Ä¶
Fast and efficient. Staff very nice and helpful.
You feel like you are in a museum..super upscale
Okay

Staff on edge in the accommodation department, very unfriendly and very expeditious. It's great to warn the public, but it's even better not to show hostility toward the people you serve. Respect, patience and politeness go both ways, especially when we decide to serve citizens.

We bitterly regret that parking spaces are constantly being reduced to the detriment of beginners and residents, that incessant work is being done even at night under inexcusable pretexts to the detriment of the well-being and health of citizens. All this has a cost which plunges the city of Paris into debt; concerning air pollution in the city the improvement is mainly only the result of the fact that cars are becoming less and less polluting while the narrowing of the roads causes enormous traffic jams at each garbage collection pass or for any delivery which also leads to an increase in pollution.

I worked in June for the elections, it is September 23 and I have not received my salary. The only contact I had ignored my emails. Participate in meetings late in the middle of the week, work from 6 a.m. to 9 p.m. in the wind. Thanks for exploiting me! To vomit ü§Æ ‚Ä¶
Very beautiful place which is also used for associations

Top service, üëå the staff is very kind, welcoming and understanding. Security directs you to the request service and the officials take the time to explain all the procedures. Thank you for your work. I like Town Hall 13. ‚Ä¶

One star due to rude and discriminatory behavior from a gray haired elderly lady.  I'm in a wheelchair and decided to take my passport photos at the town hall. According to their website, the photo booth is accessible to people with disabilities, but when I went there was a problem with the seat and I couldn't take the photos.  The lady told me it was my fault, that I should have had my file ready and that I needed to go to a photographer. My appointment was in 20 minutes, how could I go to a photographer and come back to the town hall in 20 minutes? The lady didn't understand (for me, she just didn't want to understand) that it's discriminatory to tell someone in a wheelchair that they have to go to a photographer and that they "had to arrive with their file ready", while able-bodied people can arrive quietly and take their photo before their appointment.  Other than that, the service was quick and friendly from a lady with glasses, blonde with short hair.

Resident of the Peupliers district, with the implementation of absurd prohibited directions I have to make a 2km detour in traffic jams to get home in the evening!! No consideration for local residents in this development supposedly for their comfort. Ladies and gentlemen, our elected officials, I remind you that you are supposed to be at the service of your constituents!

I had an appointment at 9:15 a.m. and I arrived at the ID card renewal service at 9:30 a.m. I am already received with the attention of not helping me, the lady at reception asks her boss to come and explain to me that I am late and that she will only be able to receive my request if my file is complete . I show her my file and she explains to me that they do not accept scanned documents (in a very pleasant tone) and that my photo is not up to date. I tell her that the same photo has just been accepted for my driving license application, to which she tells me that these are not the same standards for CNI and driving license photos... In short, as soon as I set foot in this office they decided not to help me and that's a done deal! They were unpleasant and unhelpful. A VERY bad experience.

The staff at the identity document service are particularly odious, unheard of. It would be wise not to recruit amateurs when it is almost impossible to get an appointment for an identity card at the moment. In addition, it is necessary to update the information on your site which is visibly obsolete given the way I was received

The identity card service is unbearable, contemptuous and threatening when you are annoyed at having to take identity photos again because they have different requirements from those indicated on the public service website. Irresponsible scammers

I went to the EPS service on September 24 and was very well received by everyone! The lady at reception (African, she told me) is very friendly and she was very informative. Thank you to the staff of this service and don't change anything it's so nice!!

Nice building with beautiful Christmas decorations. I see where my local taxes go.  On the other hand, queuing efficiency needs to be reviewed. For my 3rd COVID vaccine, I had to wait in front of 3 different entrance doors. To finally hear, ‚Äúwe don‚Äôt have room‚Äù. A total of 30 minutes of waiting. The information isn't even up to date online.

Beautiful, well-restored town hall, I don't know the quality of the services there but the reviews are not very encouraging. I'm especially worried about the revegetation of the place: all the paulownias look stunted and declining despite a well-watered spring. Is the thickness of topsoil sufficient? In short, with the exception of the small side gardens, the general appearance of the square remains very mineral without forgetting the incessant sweep of cars, not conducive to meditation.

A town hall which runs the road cleaning services at 3 a.m. on Sundays in the middle of August... the residents therefore have the choice between dying of heat with the windows closed or not sleeping with the incessant noise, it is good living !

Organization for the Lunar New Year parade ZERO! You should not indicate on the Town Hall website at 12 p.m. when it is 3 p.m. People, children and especially those who parade wait in the rain and in the cold!!!! What are we waiting for to raise this banner?!!! It's been a few years since I went there, in fact I should have stayed home today. Under Bertrand Delano√´, it was better organized!
Impossible to reach the town hall by telephone for urgent requests for documents. Working on the other side of Paris, it is complicated for me to get there. Unnecessary service when urgently needed.

Very unpleasant staff and more than 20 minutes late which is really very funny when you know that if we are more than 10 minutes late our appointment is canceled. And there was no one there only 2 colleagues who were chatting and laughing

It is always a pleasure to pass through the gate of the Town Hall of the 13th arrondissement of Paris, whether for administrative formalities or to participate in events like yesterday the reading of letters from the Austrian writer Stefan Zweig by the actress, director , screenwriter and singer Agn√®s Jaoui and presented by the brilliant Professor of Contemporary History and writer, Ivan Jablonka. Co-organized by the Town Hall of the 13th arrondissement, Mayor J√©r√¥me Coumet, √âditions du Portrait and the dynamic Nicole and Katia from Librairie Maruani from mother to daughter, Lecture gourmande, located at 171, bd Vincent Auriol. And today, the Seniors' Ball which took place in the same village hall, with the same crowds and passion for participating in friendly events, whether cultural or simple entertainment... Clearly, those who claim to bored in the 13th, have still not subscribed to the Newsletter, in order to receive on their mobile or tablet or computer, all the information and be notified free of charge of future programs and events offered to them.

I came to the town hall on May 22 to pay my Facil Famille balance at 10:30 a.m. at the school checkout, there were people there. So as I am 9 months pregnant, I ask if I can be given priority to the agent present. Here is his response: ‚Äúbeing pregnant is not a handicap, you queue like everyone else‚Äù. I can completely understand that there are people and that it is not possible to give me priority at that time. But less violent words exist. I am shocked to be welcomed like this in a Town Hall, where good citizenship ‚Äúshould‚Äù be applied, taught and promulgated. To which I should have responded ‚ÄúEmpathy is not innate‚Äù
If ZERO existed... civil servant incapable of answering questions to which only they have the answers! Allow themselves to hang up without warning. Disastrous staff!
Beautiful place beautiful square around a large roundabout I got married in this town hall

Too bad there is no possibility of giving less than one star.  Unpleasant passport renewal service. Refuses to take my file under the pretext that I am smiling in the photo, but this is false, forced to go to another town hall which accepted my file without problem. To avoid

I love the room. Holidays, There is a lot to see inside: paintings, sculptures, etc.  Opposite the town hall, you can see a sculpture on the roof of the Grand √âcran building. It is a multi-colored campanile in painted stainless steel, 25m high. It lights up at night. It is a work by Thierry Vid√©, designer, and Kenzo Tange, architect, created in 1992. It can be seen from the five avenues radiating from Place d'Italie.
Appointment for a passport, very friendly and smiling staff! THANKS !

I am still waiting for a reimbursement of 33E a permanent wrongly recorded by your accounting and this since the end of December, I claim I call back, I am told they are calling you back and or else evasive attitude. It is dishonest of you to act in this way, it is negligence or theft, you have all the documents to make the transfer to my account, I saw at least 4 people from the service who did not know not because the management is not done in the 13th, etc. and blabla, 6 months to settle a refund, France is really bad.

New passport appointments are offered every day on the Paris town hall website (log in in the morning and evening to check).  Appointment made in the morning for the very next day. Great welcome at the 13th arrondissement town hall, everyone has a smile and comes to meet us. Passport in 17 days is great.
A distress letter was sent directly to the mayor. The least we could do would be to respond.
Impossible to reach them on the phone after asking several times for birth certificate, no news why my mother gave birth in the worst district of Paris and the worst mayor in France
very unpleasant reception at the identity document service (passport renewal).
Very good, beautiful building, ideal for getting married

They remove passports without warning! And they don‚Äôt send text messages to say he‚Äôs arrived! Nice town hall, I made an appointment elsewhere and the town hall informed me that they are contacting people who still haven't come to collect it. To flee !

I had an appointment on Nov 7 to apply for the passport and national identity card after being naturalized. The appointment was at 11am, I only waited 5 minutes and it was all over at 11:20am. The lady in office 5 was very welcoming and friendly. The service was efficient. I thank you deeply.
Access is easy and accessible to everyone The agents are very friendly and welcoming Especially Mrs. F.C, always smiling and attentive, I thank you for your kindness
